cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, crossing Florida today, sweeping across southeast Georgia and skirting the U.S. southeast coast before moving into the Atlantic just off the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: None posted for the North Carolina coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings are in effect from Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from the Florida Big Bend through South Carolina and up to coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts possible Tuesday evening–night with a 31 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a 4 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (generally <3 ft) and dangerous surf/rip currents possible, greatest risk south of Cape Fear.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches likely with localized totals up to 8 inches as outer rain-bands spread northward Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands cannot be ruled out; hazardous seas may disrupt vessel scheduling.
